definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: She's stretched out in the sun.
sentences.chinese: 她伸开四肢躺在太阳下。

sentences.english: Guillermo put his arm around her shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 吉尔勒莫伸开胳膊搂住她的肩膀。

sentences.english: A praying mantis spreads its wings.
sentences.chinese: 一只螳螂正在伸开它的翅膀。

sentences.english: He doubled up his legs and kicked out.
Arms outspread, the completed robe with hood will form an "Ankh."
sentences.chinese: 伸开双臂，完成袍罩将形成一个“十字章。”

sentences.english: He stretched out and stared at the ceiling, as was his habit after work.
sentences.chinese: 他四肢伸开，眼睛盯着天花板，这是他下班后习惯。

sentences.english: He was sprawling in an armchair in front of the TV.
sentences.chinese: 他伸开手脚坐在电视机旁的单座沙发上。

sentences.english: Down I went, sprawled on all fours.
his left hand was still cramped, but he was unknotting it slowly.
sentences.chinese: 他的左手傲然在抽筋，但他正在逐步地把它伸开。

sentences.english: We spread ourselves on wheat straw on the farm when we were tired.
sentences.chinese: 我们累了就伸开四肢仰卧在农场的麦秸上。

sentences.english: She smacked him with her open hand.
sentences.chinese: 她伸开手打了他一巴掌。

sentences.english: Let not thy hand be stretched out to receive, and shut when thou shouldst give.
sentences.chinese: 你的手不要只为领取才伸开，而在施恩时缩回。

definition: the five fingers of one's hand
to draw together/to place side by side (e.g. one's fingers, two halves of a torn sheet of paper etc)
to hold in one's arms/to embrace
to close (flower, eyes, suitcase etc)/to bring together/(insect or bird when not flying) to fold (its wings)
